programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Charlie and Patrick Devine consider an offer for an extremely rare crystal-covered vodka bottle, and attempt to do a deal on a unique painting of boxer Muhammad Ali.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A guitar signed by David Bowie turns up in Sheffield, while potential deals in Kent include a pair of vintage Austin Seven cars and an unopened bottle of champagne from 1952.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two couples who wanted to buy dream starter homes. Paul and his bride Alissa took 18 months to find a property in Windsor, Berkshire, but with a baby on the way, size is now an issue. In London, the duo catch up with Takie and Amy, who took out a huge mortgage on a property three years earlier, to see how they are faring.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer revisits two couples he helped look for their perfect properties. Rebecca and Joe from Warwickshire needed a family home with space for their three racing camels, and did not want to move too far from their friends and good schools. In Essex, Steve and Dee had £1million to spend, but a long list of requirements, including a swimming pool and a squirrel-shaped hedge.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: David Bull and Kirsty Duffy help hypnotherapist David and his wife Carolynne determine whether to settle in a coastal part of Northumberland, or inland in the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Chimneys B&B's Carolyn and her friend Delia want some home truths from Massimo and Raf.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Wes Leaver hosts the first party in east Kent, hoping his science theme will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, the 34-year-old faces competition from estate agent Alexandra Austin, beautician Emma Phillips, dog-lover Sally Parry and fancy-dress enthusiast Stephen Drew.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Alexandra Austen hosts the second party of the week in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with pan-European cuisine. However, the meal gets off to a shaky start when Sally Parry is forced to confront her fear of beans, while Stephen Drew struggles with a goat's cheese parcel. Alexandra's decision to serve veal also proves controversial, and it soon becomes clear two of the guests are not enjoying each other's company.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. With an Absolutely Fabulous theme, a few of the diners are expecting a Mardi Gras vibe, but he has different ideas for the night - before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Beaver, Pennsylvania, where he meets a brother-and-sister team who find it almost impossible to work together. Their relationship is so fractured that they're failing to save their father's Italian restaurant from being overwhelmed by local competition, and the situation has become so desperate that their dad is in danger of losing his life savings.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Hotel
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at London's Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, located in the heart of Knightsbridge and one of the world's most exclusive hotels. It has been a favourite with royals from all around the globe, celebrities and the super-rich for more than 100 years, and the series starts with the hotel in the middle of its busy summer season. In the opening episode, the staff cater for an overseas royal visitor and her entourage, while coping with the challenges of facing directly onto one of the capital's busiest thoroughfares.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman brings in Teddy the shih-tzu cross, who has severely deformed front legs. His owner wants him to live a life without pain, but coming up with a surgical solution proves a challenge. Five-year-old golden retriever Ollie is referred to Fitzpatrick's for an operation to remove a tumour in his leg, and a young couple bring in their four-month-old bulldog, which suffered a fractured elbow after wriggling from their arms.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A distressed woman arrives at Luton police station, where officers from Bedfordshire Police's Safeguarding Unit reveal to her that her 76-year-old husband is under arrest and in custody following allegations of historical child sex abuse dating back to the 1970s. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the process as detectives investigate the veracity of the allegations to find out if they there is enough evidence to build a case.(n)

programme.title: Wife Swap
programme.desc: The reality show returns for a one-off edition. Pauline, Andy and 14-year-old Katie live on Canvey Island - the area with the nation's third highest `out' vote. For seven days, bar worker Pauline swaps her home, job and family with psychotherapist and Green Party councillor Kat, who lives in rural Nottinghamshire with her partner Roger and 17-year-old daughter Sophie. These strong-minded women immerse themselves in each other's lives and face issues around immigration, class and racism. But will they hear anything that changes their mind about Brexit?.(n)

programme.title: Battling the Bailiffs
programme.desc: Documentary about the campaigners on a mission to prevent people being evicted by standing up to bailiffs. The housing crisis has resulted in more than 50 families a week being evicted. Filmed over nine months, this film follows 42-year-old boxing trainer Chrissy Morris and his friends who are battling the system, spending their spare time travelling around the country and stopping the bailiffs in their tracks so that desperate families can keep a roof over their heads.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Women's Hospital faces a bed crisis, so shift leader Sarah and the midwives have to juggle and prioritise to ensure everyone gets the care they need. Among those facing a wait is 34-year-old home care assistant Kristina, whose twins need to be delivered as quickly as possible and will need special attention.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. After nine months of being single, 23-year-old university graduate Sapphire has decided to see if she can find her ideal woman by stripping back the layers, while 32-year-old account manager Kieron has spent the past three years single to focus on his career, but now he's ready to put finding a partner at the top of his to do list. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Phil Wang who take on guest captain Russell Howard and Roisin Conaty. Nick Helm joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on the fall-out from the General Election, Come Dine with Me and the classic Robin Williams film Mrs Doubtfire.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: An icicle the size of a house causes a street to close in Canada as contractors attempt to remove it using chainsaws, a mysterious green haze envelops Moscow 26 years to the day after the Chernobyl disaster, and the Severn tidal bore gives a surfer the chance to ride a wave for over nine miles. Plus, piles of snow in the Atacama Desert - the driest place on Earth - bubbles of frozen methane captured on camera beneath the surface of a lake, and rare footage of lightning bolts called `blue jets', which reach up to the edge of space.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Amanda and Adam Cropper find a new home in the Thai province of Phuket, which they intend to use as a holiday home before they eventually move there permanently.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. For their budget of £220,000 they're after a place to escape the British winters, as close to the amazing beaches of the Gulf of Mexico as possible. Jonnie shows them how far their budget will stretch in this highly desirable corner of the US.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick boss Nathan considers a deal on a diamond tennis bracelet, while Dan and Ellie at London Road make offers on a vintage trumpet, a mechanical digger and a gold pocket watch.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Charlie and Patrick at Nikolas Patrick value 19 pictures by American artist Darell Koons, and hit the road to look at an unusual antique chandelier and a vintage pinball machine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The odds are stacked against Noel Fitzpatrick and his team as a golden retriever puppy with horrific facial injuries is brought into the practice after being attacked by another dog. Thriller based on a short story by Stephen King, starring Maria Bello, Olympia Dukakis and Joan Jett.(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: A superb ensemble cast---including Matthew McConaughey, John Turturro, Alan Arkin and Amy Irving---is featured in this penetrating drama about several unfulfilled New Yorkers whose lives intersect. The perceptive, intricately plotted script explores the different ways people search for happiness. David Connelly, Clea DuVall(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Oliver Stone 's scorching drama of a young dealer seduced by money and power, who hooks up with a high-powered company trader. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for his performance as stockbroking devil Gordon Gekko(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: The 1995 novel by Dr. Gene Brewer becomes this drama from director Iain Softley. After a mugging incident at New York's Grand Central Station, Prot (Kevin Spacey), a man who claims to be an alien from the planet K-PAX, is turned over to a public mental hospital and the care of Dr. Mark Powell (Jeff Bridges). When medication fails to alter Prot's insistence that he is visiting from another world on a fact-finding mission, Powell gets more involved with his patient, who seems to have a calming effect on the other residents of his ward. At first convinced that Prot is a delusional who can be treated, Powell begins to wonder if his bizarre patient's story is true, particularly after the hospital's doctors find that Prot possesses the baffling ability to see ultraviolet light. As the date grows nearer when Prot claims he must leave Earth (a "class BA-III planet"), Powell becomes increasingly concerned that a psychiatric breakthrough must occur by then. K-PAX (2001) co-stars Alfre Woodard and Mary McCormack(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: A Swedish man opts for a sex change and undergoes the world's first gender reassignment surgery, but his marriage suffers as his artist wife struggles with the transition(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A staid but well-respected prep school is enlivened by a newly-arrived, charismatic English teacher, who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer, who dazzled as Jim Morrison in "The Doors" and Doc Holliday in "Tombstone," adds another outstanding real-life characterization to his résumé---John Holmes. This film chronicles the porn star's suspected involvement in a 1981 homicide that left four of his 'friends' dead. The first-rate supporting cast includes Lisa Kudrow, Eric Bogosian, Dylan McDermott and Ted Levine(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell fights to prevent a resurrected Chinese emperor taking over the world. Action sequel(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster is put through the wringer by suspense director David Fincher ("Seven") in this taut thriller. When thieves break into their Manhattan brownstone, a single mother (Foster) and her daughter hide in a high-tech, fortified "safe room." But as it turns out, the money the crooks are after is in that room. Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Dwight Yoakam, Jared Leto(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: When a horrific murder rocks the peaceful community of Holcomb, Kansas, legendary writer Truman Capote is inspired to record the shocking true story in his novel IN COLD BLOOD. Capote--accompanied by fellow wordsmith Nell Harper Lee (TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD)--travels to the Midwest in search of answers, and ends up becoming emotionally involved with one of the killers as they await trial(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Robin of Locksley returns from the Crusades to find the Sheriff of Nottingham making life miserable for the peasants of Sherwood Forest, and recruits a noble band of allies to help him defeat the dastardly lawman(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: A box office smash and written by Slyvestor Stallone as the version of 'Beverly Hills Cop' he wanted to make. Based on the novel 'Fair Game' and also stars Brigitte Nielsen(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Inspiring fact-based basketball saga about Texas Western, the first NCAA championship squad to start five black players. Josh Lucas stars as coach Don Haskins. Derek Luke, Emily Deschanel. Jon Voight costars as legendary University of Kentucky coach Adolph Rupp. Directed by James Gartner(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Rand Ravich's sci-fi thriller stars Johnny Depp (soon to be seen as J M Barrie in Neverland ) as a Nasa astronaut who loses all contact for two minutes while on a space-walk. Successfully rescued and back on Earth, he gives up his career to join a large corporation, much to the relief of his wife Charlize Theron (soon to be seen in Reindeer Games ). But, as he starts to act more strangely, she begins to wonder what actually happened in those 120 seconds and what this could mean for their unborn child(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Detective thriller. When a brilliant forensics expert is paralysed in an accident, he is left confined to his bed and suicidal. But his help is needed with a sadistic serial killer on the loose in Manhattan. A young, female rookie detective becomes his 'eyes' on the streets in a race against time to catch the guilty man(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway are a scream as two lifelong best friends who schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place (New York City's Plaza Hotel) and at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Two decades after being kicked out of a famous heavy-metal group, a failed fortysomething drummer gets a second chance to rock when he joins his teen nephew's band. Rainn Wilson ("The Office") stars in this hilarious, feel-good comedy from Peter Cattaneo, the director of "The Full Monty." Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Teddy Geiger, Emma Stone(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy fashion magazine(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The duo investigate when the body of a TV reality show star is found in a Manhattan alley. Meanwhile, things do not go according to plan when Castle tries to give Beckett a Valentine's Day gift. Crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a woman killed in what appears to be a road rage incident. However, as they retrace her last actions, they suspect she was accidentally murdered by an assassin following the wrong car. The intended victim turns out to be a reporter claiming to have uncovered a plot to rig an election by a senator, who Briscoe suspects of having connections with the Mafia.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The body of a female jogger is found in a park, and detectives Briscoe and Green discover she was mauled to death by a pit-bull terrier. The race is on to trace the animal and its owner before another tragedy occurs - and the team is shocked to discover a warehouse where dogs are trained for illegal fighting. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A man in a fancy-dress knight's costume is found stabbed with a lance in Central Park, and evidence suggests the victim had been jousting before his death. Meanwhile, another case takes a strange turn when a supposed corpse stolen from the team's custody is found in a river - alive. Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when two pharmaceutical executives are murdered, uncovering a criminal who changes his identity for each offence he commits, and has evaded capture across several countries. To make matters worse, the agents are made to feel the pressure by the watchful eye of Granger. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author hinds himself trapped at home after breaking his leg in a skiing accident. Bored by his plight, he uses his binoculars to observe events in an adjacent building - and soon believes he has witnessed a murder. Nathan Fillion stars in the 100th episode of the crime drama, with a plot loosely based on the Hitchcock thriller Rear Window.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Flashback episode going back to a case in 2010. A freelance hacker is hired to test the Machine's security system, only to find some suspicious code - and end up bundled in the boot of an enemy car for his trouble. When he escapes, Finch hires Reese's gung-ho predecessor Rick Dillinger to protect the man - but Dillinger soon realises he is up against trained government agents who also want to track him down. Jim Caviezel, Michael Emerson and Joseph Mazzello star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a publishing executive last seen engaged in a heated argument over a taxi. They learn that the killing may have been a race hate crime, with their main suspect having a long history of prejudice. However, a technicality arises in the case, threatening to deny them the conviction. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate when a priest is found murdered in the confessional booth. The arrest of a teenager with a grudge seems to have them on the right track, but after discovering that the clergyman wasn't the killer's intended target they begin to focus their search on a petrol station cashier. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A daredevil driver is decapitated while performing a stunt at a street party, bringing the festivities to a premature end. Realising the incident was murder rather than an accident, the team focuses the investigation on a bystander whose expertise with remote-controlled cars makes him a likely suspect. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An undercover police office is killed by McGee while on duty, and Jenny approves an investigation into the death. But the decision places a strain on her relationship with Gibbs as the team tries to prove that the agent was not culpable, despite the evidence building against him. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Kensi and Deeks go undercover as a married couple in a quiet suburb as part of an investigation into a Russian sleeper cell. Crime drama, starring Daniela Ruah and Eric Christian Olsen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Detectives Jaruszalski and Winters investigate a massacre during a girl's 15th birthday celebrations and track down a lead to a marijuana crop and the boy who is guarding it. Unfortunately, this brings them to the attention of the man who owns the field, with fatal consequences. Crime drama, starring Skeet Ulrich and Corey Stoll.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team reopens a 20-year-old case after receiving a letter pinpointing where the remains of a seven-year-old boy are located. Initial investigations focus on a serial killer who is on death row for murdering another child, but he denies ever touching the victim and the focus of the inquiry shifts when the last person to see the boy alive is found dead. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team is baffled by the violent murder of a prostitute who was knocked down by a car and beaten to death while talking on her phone in the street, until Stabler's son suggests the crime appears to be modelled on a scene from a popular video game. A trail of clues leads the squad to a teenage couple who claim to be unable to distinguish between fantasy and reality, but the one piece of evidence that could put them behind bars is not allowed to be used for fear of jeopardising an anti-terror investigation.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate when a professional escort is shot dead in an alley, and come to believe the real target may have been his date, who escaped with minor injuries. Further probing suggests a strange relationship between the woman and her son, leading to a meeting with a court psychiatrist. Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A hated businesswoman is found dead under an ice sculpture with her heart completely frozen. The investigators identify liquid nitrogen as the cause and discover a number of suspects among her employees and associates. Meanwhile, a woman's body falls onto the roof of a school bus - and the ensuing investigation leads Mac and Danny to a dangerous new designer drug.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A family-court judge is beaten to death in his apartment, but there is no sign of forced entry, and a college student is fatally shot in the street - with the same weapon used on the first victim. Flack fears Danny Messer is looking for revenge against Ollie Barnes, the man responsible for the robbery in which a bystander died. With Carmine Giovinazzo and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Having previously escaped Voight's grasp, cartel leader Gustav Munoz reappears on the radar when a number of dead bodies are discovered, and his men are suspected of being behind the killings. Commander Perry then throws his weight behind striking a deal with the incarcerated gangster Adres `Pulpo' Diaz, whom Perry believes may be able to lead the team to Munoz. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.desc: After an exhaustive house-hunt, crime-solving librarian Aurora finally purchases her dream home. programme.desc: An ambitious senatorial candidate murders his campaign manager for threatening to expose his secret affair. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Jackie Cooper, Ken Swofford and Tisha Sterling.(n)

Meanwhile, Callen and the rest of the team work to prove their colleague's innocence. Crime drama, starring Daniela Ruah and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kensi goes in search of her father's killer, before bumping into her mother, who she has not seen for more than 15 years. Meanwhile, the discovery that a member of Kensi's father's unit faked his own death prompts Granger to back down from his suspicions of his colleague. Crime drama, starring Daniela Ruah and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.desc: The team is forced to establish whether the gunning down of a man outside the Vietnamese Consulate is an isolated incident or a terrorist attack, facing a race against time to ensure the safety of delegates at an upcoming international conference. Crime drama, guest starring Dan Lauria (The Wonder Years).(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy intelligence officer, and the choice of murder weapon leads the agents to believe he was killed by a colleague. However, while former Seal Sam threatens to compromise the integrity of the case, evidence suggests the victim may have been selling secrets to the enemy.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part one of two. Hetty dispatches the team to recover a book containing top-secret information, which has been stolen from the personal effects of a murdered antiques dealer. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.desc: Pride becomes convinced that Paul Jenks, the so-called `Baitfish' has returned. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. programme.title: Zookeeper
programme.desc: Beloved zookeeper Griffin Keyes (Kevin James) decides to quit his job to dive into the dating pool, and finds that his animal friends have been harboring an incredible secret in this comedy from director Frank Coraci (The Wedding Singer, Click). Griffin is a single guy who loves his job at the Franklin Park Zoo. He has a special bond with the animals, yet he can't help but feel lonely each night when he returns to an empty house. Eventually deciding that a more prestigious job may be the key to finding a new girlfriend, Griffin prepares to turn in his walking papers and reinvent himself. But when word gets out to the animals that Griffin will soon be leaving, they realize the only way to keep him around is to reveal they have the gift of the gab. Perhaps with a little dating advice from his friends in the animal kingdom, this lonely zookeeper will manage to meet the girl of his dreams without losing the job he loves. Rosario Dawson co-stars in a comedy featuring the voices of Sylvester Stallone, Adam Sandler, Cher, and Nick Nolte(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

Each summer a bunch of greedy grasshoppers descends demanding food, which the peace-loving ants grudgingly supply. Then one year a rebel ant called Flik decides to enlist the help of an unemployed troupe of bug performers from a second rate flea circus to fight the intruders. Typical episodes demonstrated CPR techniques, the extinguishing of household fires, and the handling of moral dilemmas. Also offered were tips on building, cooking and general housekeeping, with added input from experts in these fields. programme.desc: Richard Gere and Bob Hoskins star in Francis Ford Coppola's panorama of love, crime and entertainment in this stylish gangster film, centred on the legendary Harlem Nightclub. (1984)(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Cat-and-mouse chiller in which a brother and sister's journey home from college turns into a terrifying struggle for survival after they make a grim discovery on a remote road(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent tries to infiltrate a powerful crime ring. But when a bust goes bad, he lands in the recently reopened, high-tech Alcatraz, where he remains undercover as thieves try to find a cache of stolen gold(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Action drama in which an old Vietnam veteran who is disillusioned with the hi-tech, by-the-book modern military, requests a posting to his old unit to see out his soldiering days. Tough and foul-mouthed, the marine sergeant puts a squadron of lazy young recruits through their paces, turning them into a well disciplined fighting unit - just in time for a hazardous rescue mission to the small Caribbean island of Grenada(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Con artists Will and Jake Grimm (Matt Damon and Heath Ledger) encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse that requires more than their usual fakery(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers. They put him on the trail of the manufacturers of a dangerous new hallucinogen that causes users to become both violent and fearless. But, just as he seems to be making progress, he finds himself prime suspect for a murder he did not commit..(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Remake of the Japanese horror hit about a strange videotape. Whoever watches it is told they have seven days to live. A reporter tracks down the tape and has a week to solve the mystery(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: This intense and unnerving thriller should make viewers' skin crawl. Ashley Judd stars as an Oklahoma waitress who's battling her own addictive demons. She takes on a whole new set of problems when she gets involved with an unhinged Gulf War vet (Michael Shannon) who's wracked with paranoid delusions involving invasive insects and clandestine military experiments. Directed by William Friedkin and written by Tracy Letts, who adapted his stage play. Harry Connick Jr., Lynn Collins(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: In this spooky and surreal chiller, an American movie producer (Anastasia Hille) searching for her birth parents inherits a house in Russia that holds dark and dangerous secrets from her past. Directed by Nacho Cerda(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A suburban couple returning to their semi-secluded house after attending a wedding finds their lives suddenly thrown into chaos with the arrival of three malevolent, masked strangers in director Bryan Bertino's tense tale of survival. Liv Tyler and Scott Speedman star as the couple forced to resort to violence they never thought themselves capable of as they struggle for their lives, and model-turned-actress Gemma Ward continues her transition from the catwalk to the silver screen as one of the merciless masked invaders(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A gripping drama based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: On Time
programme.desc: A woman who is running late for a job interview is forced to make a tough decision. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen travelling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels director Guy Ritchie heads back to the London underworld for this hyperkinetic crime comedy concerning a shady land deal that leaves every schemer in the city determined to get rich or die trying. When a Russian mobster orchestrates a lucrative real estate scam, every criminal in London wants a piece of the action. Greed is the universal language, and everyone from unrelenting crime boss Lenny Cole (Tom Wilkinson) to street-smart criminal One Two (Gerard Butler), corrupt accountant Stella (Thandie Newton), and unpredictable punk rocker Johnny Quid (Toby Kebbell) seem to speak it fluently. As the bullets start to fly and the double crosses multiply, there's no telling who will walk away with the fortune after the gun smoke has cleared. Jeremy Piven, Chris "Ludacris" Bridges, and Quantum of Solace Bond girl Gemma Arterton co-star(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Bruce Banner's attempts to deal with his explosive anger issues are complicated when soldier Emil Blonsky undergoes a similar transformation(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Taut thriller about a police inspector trying to snare a sniper who has threatened to kill a person a day(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: The second action thriller in the Dirty Harry series sees maverick cop Harry Callahan investigating the slaying of some of the West Coast's most powerful criminals. Dismissing the theory that the murders are the result of underworld squabbling, Callahan learns that each of the victims was killed by a slug from a .357 Magnum - the most powerful handgun in the world, and a weapon widely used within the San Francisco Police Department(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Four soldiers, finding a map indicating the location of secret bunkers inside the Iraqi border, go AWOL and head for the bunkers to get the gold looted from Kuwait which they believe to be hidden inside. However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A member of the future human-resistance movement is teleported back to 1984 L.A. His purpose is to rescue Sarah Connor, the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against tyrannical machines, from being killed before she can give birth. Standing in his way is a futuristic cyborg also sent back in time to assassinate the woman(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this feature-film adaptation of the popular fantasy video-game series. After realizing that their home is becoming uninhabitable, a race of orcs travel to the land of Azeroth. There, they encounter the realm's human denizens, who fight back against the invaders. In time, an orc warrior (Toby Kebbell) forges an alliance with a group of humans in order to overthrow his race's corrupt leader (Daniel Wu) and bring peace to the land. Directed by Duncan Jones (Moon), the film co-stars Paula Patton (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol), Ben Foster (3:10 to Yuma), Dominic Cooper (The Devil's Double), Ruth Negga (World War Z), and Travis Fimmel (Vikings)(n)

programme.title: My Cat From Hell

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Mayday! Mayday!. A cat guardian about to move to Canada needs help with her two very feral cats. Also: Jackson experiences a vicious, but illuminating, cat attack(n)

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Mojito Cat. Jackson returns to Colorado to keep a favorite kitten from the rescue road trip in its forever home; a boy learns how to train a kitten; a young man with a cat phobia gets help(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley reports live from central London with the City of London Police, finding out how people can keep safe from thieves on mopeds, a crime that is on the rise.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties set to be auctioned in Worthing West Sussex, Telford in Shropshire and Risca in south-east Wales, then talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: Seventy-three-year-old Peter attends Birmingham's Queen Elizabeth Hospital to have a biopsy because doctors are concerned his prostate cancer may have spread to his bladder.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright joins housing officers and the police as they discover children home alone. Plus, a tenant is at risk from a potentially lethal leak.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. Eric Knowles hosts.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid and Megan's first date fails to go well, while normally steadfast copper Rob misses a dinner with Ruhma and Heston - apparently unable to face human interaction.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: The current set of players faces its final day competing for the chance to win £10,000 before 24 new faces arrive. Game show, hosted by Rick Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple to search for a property in the north Somerset countryside on a £700,000 budget, and away from the hunt, he takes a seashore safari.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Bryn Williams, Kim Woodward, Ryan Simpson and Atul Kochhar pair up with their chosen home cook partners, with Pierre Koffmann on hand to judge their final dishes.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Neighbours Ilona Watson and Fay Baxter started a community cafe to help bring their divided village in Rogiet, Monmouthshire, together. Ilona's husband Andy is severely disabled after a fall and Fay looks after her elderly mother who has advanced dementia. Presenters Paul Martin and Tim Weeks ask local residents to donate unwanted items to sell at a street auction so that the two unsuspecting women can be treated to a short break away.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Richard Osman joins Alex Jones for the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: English cricketer Paul Collingwood, Olympic gymnast Amy Tinkler, Paralympic table tennis star Will Bayley, and former Republic of Ireland international footballer Clinton Morrison join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker on the light-hearted quiz.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise struggles with the repercussions of Keegan's claims, so Bex encourages her to reveal what has been happening to Sharon. Joyce is fearful of the Taylors, and despite Ted's attempts to calm his wife's worries, it seems the new family are indeed getting off to a bad start with some of the neighbours. Lauren suggests to Steven that things might not be going all that well, but his idea of a day together does not go to plan - and Abi's meddling only makes matters worse.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: A knock on the head results in Arthur joining the police force as a high-ranking detective and it is up to Michael and the regulars from the cafe to bring him back to reality. Comedy, with Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts satirical current affairs quiz, inviting Labour MP Angela Eagle and comedian Phil Wang to join team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hospital People
programme.desc: Susan Mitchell decides to record a charity single to raise funds for Brimlington Hospital. Local choirmaster Neville Burley is brought in to produce it, but before long the two fall out. Kenny prepares for his audition in the choir, Ivan gets to grips with his new studio equipment, and Ian's talents are finally recognised by the outside world. Tom Binns and James Fleet star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by Hollywood star Mark Wahlberg, currently promoting Transformers: The Last Knight and British actor Tom Holland, the titular star of Spider-Man: Homecoming. Plus, Woody Harrelson and Andy Serkis reflect on their new offering, War for the Planet of the Apes, and Sienna Miller talks about Cat on a Hot Tin Roof at the Young Vic. Alison Moyet performs Reassuring Pinches, while the host subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair.(n)

programme.title: Disturbia
programme.desc: A troubled teenager is sentenced to three months under house arrest for attacking a teacher, and passes the time by spying on his neighbours. However, one day he notices something suspicious and becomes convinced one of them is a serial killer. Thriller, starring Shia LaBeouf, Carrie-Anne Moss, David Morse and Sarah Roemer.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Former Spice Girl Geri Horner joins host Matt Tebbutt to sample dishes prepared in the studio kitchen by Ghanaian food specialist Zoe Adjonyoh and chef Theo Randall.(n)

programme.title: Trooping the Colour
programme.desc: Coverage of the annual pageant, which officially marks the birthday of HM Queen Elizabeth II, performed by the 1st Battalion Irish Guards on Horse Guards Parade.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Bislett Games. Gabby Logan presents highlights from Oslo of the fifth round of the season, staged at the Bislett Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Warrington Wolves v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the third quarter-final, which takes place between the Super League sides at the Halliwell Jones Stadium. The Wolves were edged out in a thrilling final last year by Hull FC, and predicting the outcome of this match is difficult, given both clubs' inconsistent form in the league.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts as more famous faces settle into the black chair, with the opening edition seeing chef Paul Rankin, TV presenter Sonali Shah, comedian Omid Djalili and CBBC's Hacker T Dog answering questions on the specialist subjects of Stieg Larsson's Millennium trilogy, the human body, Chelsea FC, and Pet Shop Boys. The second round sees them putting their general knowledge to the test in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition based on the subject of music, as Sinitta, Jaymi Hensley, Vernie Bennett, Easther Bennett, Claire Richards, Ian 'H' Watkins, Tony Christie and Ben Adams try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Richard Osman is the man with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord finally gets a chance to find out whether he really is Scottish, or just cross, as he and Bill visit ancient Aberdeenshire. Their mission: to solve the mystery of what happened to the Ninth Legion of the Roman army, which vanished from records after marching beyond Hadrian's Wall and into the mists of Scotland during the second century. Bill has cooked up a theory about the fate that befell the missing soldiers, but what she discovers is far more dangerous - a cairn on a hillside containing a doorway to the end of the world. Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: New series. Mel Giedroyc presents the choral music contest, in which choirs of all sizes, genres and voices compete in a series of head-to-head knock-out challenges. First, each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. The winning group will be decided by a panel of experts, including crusading choirmaster Gareth Malone, former choir-girl Kelis, and this week's guest judge Will Young.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.sub-title: Do Not Stand at My Grave and Weep.
programme.desc: The day of Cal's funeral arrives, and when details emerge of how his brother spent his final moments, a troubled Ethan turns to drink. Meanwhile, a school trip to France comes to an abrupt end when a scuffle on board the coach causes it to crash. As a result, the ED is inundated with teenage patients, including Sean, whose unusual vitamin tablets ring alarm-bells for the staff, and Sky, whose mother is a long-term advocate of alternative medicine, and is not happy about her daughter receiving an X-ray scan.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is upset that Trevor has decided to work for a mission project in Africa, and resolves to give him an unforgettable send-off to remind him of the loving family he has in Ireland. Cathy's family counselling session descends into chaos, Buster and Dermot land themselves in trouble because of a circus lion, and neighbour Winnie is delighted that her husband's libido has returned. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Knights
programme.desc: Chinese sheriff Chon Wang and reformed bandit Roy O'Bannon head for Victorian London on the trail of a murderer. Their investigation leads them to a nefarious Englishman plotting to kill the royal family - but fortunately Chon's talented sister comes to their aid. Martial arts comedy sequel, with Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Aidan Gillen and Fann Wong.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British flying doctor fights to save the life of a biker in the back of a moving ambulance racing towards Sydney, while two UK policemen hunt a wanted suspect in the Outback.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Richard Madley search for bargains at the Newark antique and collectors fair and presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Masson Mills in Derbyshire.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Atul Kochhar puts three cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make the perfect onion bhaji, choosing one of the amateurs to join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: New series. As the cooking contest returns, 24 chefs compete for a chance to show off their culinary skills at a banquet honouring 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. This week it's the turn of three chefs from London and the South East who are all first timers in the competition. Tom Kemble, Mike Reid and Selin Kiazim meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their summery starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose.
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which adventurer Paul Rose explores the 79 miles of the Yorkshire Wolds Way, one of Britain's least well-known national walking trails. The trail starts at the Humber Estuary and ends at the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Filey. On the way, Paul takes in the views from the top of the Humber Bridge, learns to ride a penny farthing and searches out the spots made internationally famous by the artist David Hockney.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Natalie Barker meets her father for the third time to ask him an important question and Hugh McGarvey sets out to find a cousin who left Glasgow for a new life in Ireland.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Bridget incites Vincent to exact personal revenge on the Hennessys and Paudge's principled bid to protect a young woman results in a serious reprisal from Beady Burke.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A brutal turn of events rocks the Garda as Paudge faces judgement day. Christmas cheer is in short supply for Katie and David, in conflict over their child's future again. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: With the help of eyewitness footage, first-hand accounts and scientific explanations, Chris Packham looks at natural events that stop people in their tracks and disrupt their lives. He examines the reasons why a village was invaded by billions of tiny crabs and investigates the cases of locals faced with a herd of angry elk and the residents of a town who woke up to an apocalyptic sky.(n)

programme.title: Operation Iceberg
programme.desc: Part two of two. Chris Packham, Helen Czerski, Andy Torbet, Chris van Tulleken and Doug Allan continue their adventures in the Arctic, boarding an unpredictable iceberg to determine whether the impact of waves on the ice or the warming temperature of the surrounding water causes them to decay. Andy and Doug dive into the sea, medic Chris Van Tulleken looks at the physiological reactions of the human body in extreme immersion and Chris Packham takes to the skies to conduct a census documenting just how many polar bears could be living on the berg.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and James Lewis begin the final day of their road trip in the Dorset town of Dorchester. They then travel to Portsmouth and Fareham in neighbouring Hampshire, before heading to their last auction of the week in London.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Julian Clary welcomes Hide Share into his garden and actor Sam West joins Chris Packham on the sofa. Plus, a feature on a Wildlife Hero from Northern Ireland. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads for the Netherlands, a compact country which boasted a global empire to rival that of Britain. Whilst on his travels, Michael operates a crane in Europe's largest container port in Rotterdam, discovers the magnificent art and architecture of the Dutch Golden Age, and experiences the power of Kinderdijk's picturesque windmills.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Jordanne Whiley - who with Yui Kamiji is the current Wimbledon wheelchair doubles holder - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Blood is spilt as the sumptuous period drama reaches its penultimate episode. Realising he is less than God-like, Louis XIV receives advice from pious Madame Scarron - but can the king truly humble himself? Desperate Madame de Montespan is persuaded a dark ritual will reverse her fall from grace. Ordered to initiate intimacy with traitorous Thomas, Philippe finds himself forced to mask the motive from Chevalier to prevent an expected brutal response. George Blagden, Catherine Walker, Anna Brewster, Mark Rendall, Alexander Vlahos and Evan Williams star.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: Direct from Pinewood Studios, the comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news - with a panel of guests including Sara Pascoe and Katherine Ryan prepared to take the Scotsman to task over his claims.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Confetti
programme.desc: Three couples compete for the title of Most Original Wedding of the Year, with a film crew following the preparations. Theatre-loving Matt and Sam plan a musical marriage, naturists Michael and Joanna brave the elements for their all-nude nuptials, while fiercely competitive Josef and Isabelle warm up for a sporty ceremony. Spoof documentary, starring Martin Freeman, Jessica Hynes, Robert Webb, Olivia Colman, Stephen Mangan and Meredith MacNeill.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Academy Summer Exhibition
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark and Brenda Emmanus tour the Royal Academy galleries during a glamorous private preview of this year's Summer Exhibition, which is due to open to the public on Tuesday. The exhibition sees established British artists displaying work alongside that of less well-known contemporaries, and here, Kirsty and Brenda go behind the scenes of the event in the run-up to the grand opening. The pair meet some of the featured artists, and explore the process of curating the world's largest open-submission exhibition.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Theresa May's election gamble has resulted in a catastrophic outcome for the Conservatives, while Labour under Jeremy Corbyn has defied many expectations. Following the vote that has changed the face of British politics, Nick Robinson asks how and why it happened.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part two of two. Engineers must construct and fit out a new station at Paddington and erect a great glass canopy to soar above the structure, while workers at Tottenham Court Road are building underground platforms and concourses the size of an aircraft carrier in the heart of the world's busiest shopping district. In Derby, a father and son team race to construct 66 trains to ferry passengers across the 30 miles of Crossrail line.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord, Bill and Nardole find themselves on Mars, but despite removing themselves from Earth, they still end up embroiled in yet another stand-off between humanity and alien forces. This time, though, mankind has become the aggressor. In a bid to extend their queen's empire into space, Victorian soldiers have somehow invaded the red planet, and their activities threaten to awaken a hive of militant Ice Warriors, for whom Mars is home. As tensions escalate, the Doctor faces a unique dilemma. He has vowed to serve humanity as its protector, but when it is the humans who are the invaders, whose side should he take? Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: In Name Only
programme.desc: Wealthy socialite Alec Walker falls for widow Julie Eden - but reckons without his own ruthless wife's attempts to derail the new romance by refusing him a divorce. Marital drama, starring Cary Grant, Carole Lombard, Kay Francis, Charles Coburn and Helen Vinson.(n)

programme.title: Wonder Man
programme.desc: Nightclub entertainer Buzzy Bellew witnesses a murder committed by gangster Ten Grand Jackson and is killed by two of his thugs. Buzzy comes back as a ghost and tries to persuade his bookish twin Edwin Dingle to avenge his death by helping the police catch Jackson. Comedy musical, starring Danny Kaye, Virginia Mayo, Vera-Ellen, Donald Woods and Steve Cochran.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty Halls returns to his roots as a marine biologist, setting up home for the summer in the fishing village of Roundstone on the west coast of Ireland. Whales, dolphins, porpoises and sharks can be found in the waters off Connemara during their migrations, and Monty's task is to collect information on the numbers passing through the area before the winter storms arrive.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Central region heats sees returning contender Pip Lacey and newcomers Ryan Simpson and Nick Deverell-Smith preparing their starters. They must impress a Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for the judges in the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central region chefs fight it out for the fish course, with Pip Lacey combining lobster with strawberry in tribute to the classic Wimbledon strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson also uses lobster in his recreation of a barbecue and has invented a special technique to create his unique chips, while Nick Deverell-Smith focuses on crab to make a savoury cream tea.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge gives step-by-step instructions for recipes to impress guests at dinner parties, preparing two varieties of canapes, a salmon and asparagus starter, a main course of guinea fowl, and a chocolate tart for pudding. Mary also reveals a trick for cooking steak ahead of time that guarantees perfect results.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached bungalow in Huthwaite, Nottinghamshire, a one-bedroom 1950s flat in London's Wandsworth and a former shop complete with three flats in Delabole, Cornwall are all sold at auction. Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners to hear about their plans for the properties, before cameras return to see how they have got on.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In a special one-hour edition of the show, Caroline Hawley and Colin Young each help two teams search for potentially profitable items at an antiques fair in Builth Wells, Powys. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott reports on a rare book he finds at the event, and visits the V&A Museum of Childhood in east London.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A profile of the movie actor, who died in September 2008. Newman won an Academy Award for his performance in the 1986 Martin Scorsese-directed film The Color of Money, and was nominated eight further times in his career. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
programme.desc: A dying plantation owner summons his two sons to put his estate in order. The older of the pair, a washed-up American football player with a drinking problem, is tormented by the death of a friend and resents his loyally supportive wife, and is forced by the reunion to come to terms with his personal demons. Drama based on Tennessee Williams' stage play, starring Paul Newman, Elizabeth Taylor and Burl Ives.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin leads a team of antiques experts, including Thomas Plant and James Lewis, as they appraise interesting and valuable items to take to auction in Sheffield. Among the finds brought in by members of the public are a tortoiseshell locket, a Georgian tankard and a disconcerting electrotherapy kit. Paul also meets two women who were recently awarded honours for keeping the city's steel mills running during the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The second of two programmes sees Michael Portillo continue his journey through the Netherlands. Along the way, the political pundit roots around the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem and investigates Amsterdam's famous red light district. In Haarlem, Michael sees how 21 million stems and two million potted plants are auctioned every day from a vast complex roughly the size of Monaco. Arriving in Utrecht, the presenter observes the main hub of the Dutch railway network and its busiest station, discovering that the first constitution of the Netherlands was signed here.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: Trooping the Colour
programme.desc: Another chance to see highlights from the annual ceremony, in which the 1st Battalion Irish Guards marked the birthday of HM Queen Elizabeth II on Horse Guards Parade.(n)

programme.title: The Venice Biennale: Sink or Swim
programme.desc: Brenda Emmanus follows a diverse team of emerging artists as they install and prepare to launch the first-ever Diaspora Pavilion at the Venetian Palazzo during the Venice Biennale. The annual art exhibition gives artists a chance to demonstrate their talents to the exclusive network of curators, museum directors and buyers that attend the festival in its opening week, and this documentary follows the undiscovered creatives as they navigate VIP launch parties and find new inspiration among the many exhibitions across the city.(n)

programme.title: Live International Rugby Union
programme.desc: Argentina v England (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the concluding match of the two-Test series, staged at the Estadio Brigadier General Estanislao Lopez, Santa Fe. While England are shorn of several players representing the British & Irish Lions in New Zealand, Eddie Jones has been able to select a squad with a fine balance of experience and youth for this challenging tour against the Pumas. With analysis by Brian Moore, Ugo Monye and Jeremy Guscott.(n)

programme.title: Kevin Bridges: A Whole Different Story
programme.desc: The comedian on stage at Glasgow's SSE Hydro during his 2015 stand-up tour. He entertains 12,000 fans with his thoughts on economic theory, art history and diet tips, as well as politics and the Scottish referendum. He also deals with the rigours of growing up and adapting to his new-found place in the world - coupled with the added novelty of having money for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Blood is spilt as the sumptuous period drama reaches its penultimate episode. Realising he is less than God-like, Louis XIV receives advice from pious Madame Scarron - but can the king truly humble himself? Desperate Madame de Montespan is persuaded a dark ritual will reverse her fall from grace. Ordered to initiate intimacy with traitorous Thomas, Philippe finds himself forced to mask the motive from Chevalier to prevent an expected brutal response. George Blagden, Catherine Walker, Anna Brewster, Mark Rendall, Alexander Vlahos and Evan Williams star.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and American soprano Angel Blue present highlights from the final heat of the contest, as singers from Armenia, England, Scotland, Uzbekistan and Australia perform arias by composers including Handel, Massenet and Gounod. Anush Hovhannisyan, Dominic Barberi, Catriona Morison, Kang Wang or Barnokhon Ismatullaeva will join the three previous night's winners in the final. The international jury will also select a wildcard chosen from across the rounds to complete the line-up. The Orchestra of Welsh National Opera is conducted by Tomas Hanus.(n)

programme.title: The Summer of Love: How Hippies Changed the World
programme.desc: The second of two programmes explores how the 1967 Summer of Love set in motion an era of social upheaval that pitted America's youth against its elders, and how the US government responded with a series of brutal crackdowns. The hippies failed politically, but their cultural influence touched on later movements in environment and health, and led to the birth of feminism. Most surprising of all, hippie ideas first imagined on LSD went on to shape the information age itself.(n)

programme.title: Pink Floyd Beginnings 1967 - 1972
programme.desc: After The Dark Side of the Moon became a global smash in 1973, rock band Pink Floyd concentrated on the creative freedom of live performance, leaving the world of TV behind. Now, after painstaking research, tapes of some early historic appearances have been tracked down and compiled, offering an insight into Floyd's initial work, and providing clues as to the origins of their later material.(n)

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.sub-title: Classic Albums: The Beach Boys - Pet Sounds.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the making of the Beach Boys' classic 1966 album, to mark the 50th anniversary of its release. Featuring contributions from songwriter Brian Wilson and the other surviving members of the group Mike Love, Al Jardine, Bruce Johnston and David Marks, as well as rare archive footage from the recording sessions.(n)

programme.title: Status Quo: Live and Acoustic
programme.desc: A compilation of footage from Status Quo's 2014 live appearance at London's Roundhouse, where they performed acoustic versions of their best-known hits, including Pictures of Matchstick Men, Rockin' All Over the World, Whatever You Want, What You're Proposing, Down Down, and Marguerita Time. Playing alongside a string section, Francis and Rick reminisce about their career and recall some of the stories behind their classic songs.(n)

programme.title: The Summer of Love: How Hippies Changed the World
programme.desc: The second of two programmes explores how the 1967 Summer of Love set in motion an era of social upheaval that pitted America's youth against its elders, and how the US government responded with a series of brutal crackdowns. The hippies failed politically, but their cultural influence touched on later movements in environment and health, and led to the birth of feminism. Most surprising of all, hippie ideas first imagined on LSD went on to shape the information age itself.(n)

programme.title: Pink Floyd Beginnings 1967 - 1972
programme.desc: After The Dark Side of the Moon became a global smash in 1973, rock band Pink Floyd concentrated on the creative freedom of live performance, leaving the world of TV behind. Now, after painstaking research, tapes of some early historic appearances have been tracked down and compiled, offering an insight into Floyd's initial work, and providing clues as to the origins of their later material.(n)

programme.title: Totally 60s Psychedelic Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the genre from programmes such as Colour Me Pop, How It Is, Top of the Pops and Once More with Felix. Performers include Status Quo, the Incredible String Band, Donovan, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band, Julie Driscoll with Brian Auger and the Trinity, the Moody Blues, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Joe Cocker, the Move, Procol Harum, Cream, Jimi Hendrix and the Who.(n)

programme.title: Nicola Benedetti's Indian Serenade
programme.desc: Documentary following the violinist as she joins the Scottish Symphony Orchestra on a tour of India, going behind the scenes with her as she plays in Mumbai and New Delhi and experiences the country for the very first time. Nicola also takes part in workshops for local children and gives an informal performance to pupils at a Mumbai municipal school.(n)

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and American soprano Angel Blue are in Cardiff to host the first of this year's two grand finals. Today, the winner of the Song Prize will be announced, which sees the five most successful entrants performing an intimate `Art Song' or Lieder to the panel of expert judges. This time, instead of being supported by an orchestra, accompaniment will come in the form of a single piano, and on hand to discuss the performances are celebrated lyric tenor John Mark Ainsley and leading vocal coach Mary King.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: The discovery of Woody Baldwin's body gives Cardinal and Delorme a chance to connect the murders to Eric Fraser, and the race to catch him before he kills Keith.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal

programme.title: Lemmy: The Movie
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life of the Motorhead frontman, following him on various tours over the course of three years. The film examines his rise to fame in the 1970s and the influence of the band's distinctive sound on punk and heavy metal groups. With contributions by Alice Cooper, Dave Grohl, Peter Hook, Jarvis Cocker, Mick Jones and Metallica's James Hetfield and Robert Trujillo.(n)

Micky is persuaded to sever ties with his family after a series of disastrous fights, but when a shot at the world championship title presents itself, the brothers must reconcile to meet the challenge. With Mark Wahlberg, Amy Adams and Oscar-winning performances from Christian Bale and Melissa Leo.(n)
