programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson tries to rehabilitate the reputation of the MGB sports car, while Alex Riley watches his childhood hero Derek Bell get back into a Porsche 962 and compete in the Group C support race at Le Mans. Jodie Kidd and her husband David Blakely take part in the Mille Miglia endurance race in a 1953 Jaguar XK120 drophead coupe, and Bruno Senna puts a 1963 Jaguar lightweight E-type through its paces on the handling track.(n)

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from round five at Croft, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season were set to take place. Commentary by David Addison and Tim Harvey.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of today's races. From York, races start at 1.50, 2.20, 2.55 and 3.30. From Musselburgh, at 2.05 and 3.10. From Sandown Park, at 2.40. Analysis and reporting comes from Luke Harvey, Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes a risky purchase at a car auction, and ends up with a vehicle that may be past saving.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a custom-built Harley Davidson rat bike, and appraise an oil painting by Jim Daly. However, a painful staff mishap leaves them one person short.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An intriguing Civil War pistol stokes the guys' interest, while a purportedly genuine signed photo of ex-president Benjamin Harrison comes under scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A particularly eclectic selection lies in store for the pawn shop staff, including a letter signed by Napoleon Bonaparte, a set of 1940s Las Vegas police badges and an antique pogo stick.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team goes wild for a collection of signed Metallica memorabilia and a first edition copy of 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys stumble on a collection of Beatles memorabilia signed by all four members of the group, and try to find a new hobby for the Old Man.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a look at a 1951 Chevy driven by Steve McQueen in his final film, while a man brings in a Colt .45 allegedly used to shoot Jesse James.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A security guard is murdered during a payroll snatch, and Regan and Carter are called in to support local investigating officers. However, bad blood between the maverick detective inspector and the force's chief superintendent going back several years manifests itself in an old allegation of corruption being rekindled. Richard Griffiths features alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman in the final episode of the crime drama.(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Ellen Brody, the widow of heroic police chief Martin Brody, travels to the Bahamas after her youngest son is killed by a great white shark. But as she is reunited with her surviving son, the predatory fish sets off in pursuit to wipe out the entire family. Thriller sequel, starring Michael Caine, Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest and Mario Van Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Ellen Brody, the widow of heroic police chief Martin Brody, travels to the Bahamas after her youngest son is killed by a great white shark. But as she is reunited with her surviving son, the predatory fish sets off in pursuit to wipe out the entire family. Thriller sequel, starring Michael Caine, Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest and Mario Van Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Criminals are employed by a crime boss to carry out a diamond robbery that goes disastrously wrong. In the bloody aftermath of the heist, they try to establish what happened and how the police were aware of their plans all along - leading to the hardening suspicion that one of them betrayed the gang. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Criminals are employed by a crime boss to carry out a diamond robbery that goes disastrously wrong. In the bloody aftermath of the heist, they try to establish what happened and how the police were aware of their plans all along - leading to the hardening suspicion that one of them betrayed the gang. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.desc: James Nesbitt traces connections between 1987 drama series The Charmer, starring Nigel Havers and 2005 supernatural series Afterlife, starring Lesley Sharp with Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: Micawber
programme.desc: The impoverished gent is arrested for his debts and prosecuted in court by his own brother-in-law, as a result of which he gets thrown into prison. But just when it seems things cannot get any worse, his debts are paid off by a grateful former client who employs him to entertain two American businessmen on the London leg of their European tour. In typical fashion, Micawber throws himself into the task and draws up an itinerary of museums and theatre - but he soon discovers the duo are more interested in dens of vice. David Jason stars in the Dickens-inspired drama, with Annabelle Apsion, Milton Johns and Sam Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: David gives an old friend a shattering piece of advice, but struggles to practise what he preaches. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Gary Mavers and Adrian Lukis.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: On the eve of an important dinner party, Mrs Bridges breaks down and steals a baby. Period drama, staring Angela Baddely and Gordon Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Elsewhere, new doctor Danny has a baptism of fire when he informs the wrong family of a patient's death - and later gets held up at gunpoint, along with Robert, by a man seeking revenge for the death of his son. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick's relationship with Kate suffers when he goes for a job interview in London, and Greengrass is convicted for sheep rustling, although holes in the evidence are discovered. Meanwhile, Alan Maskell leaves the area while on bail for and unbeknown to him, his wife suffers a miscarriage at the same time. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Brideshead Revisited
programme.desc: Lady Marchmain bans alcohol from the house, but Sebastian is undeterred by her firm views and sneaks off to the local pub - only to vanish, filling Charles with foreboding.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: When his cousin Cosmo visits and worms his way into Mrs Betts' affections, Silas is enraged and vows to get even. Unfortunately, his plans go awry, leaving him more than a little red-faced. With Sue Johnston, Emma Fielding and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: Sam's wife Connie confides to Silas that she has not had much fun of late - only for her husband to turn up unexpectedly, leaving the rogue trapped in the cellar with only a drop of home-made wine to sustain his flagging spirits. Albert Finney, Lesley Dunlop and Gary Whelan star.(n)

programme.title: Micawber
programme.desc: The family's fortunes look up once more when Micawber gets a job as butler to an eccentric aristocratic couple. However, it soon becomes clear her ladyship has taken quite a shine to her new manservant, and for a while he is flattered by her attentions - until he realises his lordship has a tendency to gun down in cold blood anyone dallying with his wife. David Jason stars in the final episode of the Dickens-inspired drama, with Annabelle Apsion, Jan Francis, Michael Cochrane and Michael Troughton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.sub-title: Map of the Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: First of a two-part episode. David tries to help a troubled teenager, but his good deed ends up risking the happiness of everyone around him. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Adrian Lukis and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A feud between warring neighbours turns into a siege when Nick is held at gunpoint. Meanwhile, Kate puts her own life at risk to save a dying man. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth and James Bellamy discover former housemaid Sarah has fallen on hard times and decide to reinstate her in the household, but it isn't long before their charitable gesture backfires in unexpected fashion. Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh, Simon Williams and Pauline Collins star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. The detective receives a disturbing phone message from estranged brother Roy and heads to Harrogate to find him. Meanwhile at a murder scene, the team is introduced to new recruit Helen Morton, who quickly alienates her colleagues with her tactless style. The officer then makes matters worse when she finds evidence linking Banks to the victim's body and speculates he could be a suspect. Unaware everyone is searching for him, the DCI begins to delve into Roy's life and soon uncovers questionable business transactions and associates. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, with Caroline Catz (Doc Martin) and Andrea Lowe.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detective visits his childhood home to break the news of Roy's death, and his parents plead with him to find out what happened. Defying Morton, Banks returns to the station in an attempt to lead the investigation into the murders of his brother and Jennifer Lewis, and both officers are convinced the key to cracking the cases lies with a woman being treated at a clinic. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: The police officers are numb after the explosion, and as they search the rubble, they make a horrifying realisation. The Bentleys make one last stand as a manhunt is launched for Clifford and David, while a distraught Renee is put under arrest. Before long Tennison makes one final discovery about Julie Ann's murder - but as she gets closer to solving the case, she finds herself in mortal danger. Stefanie Martini stars as the novice WPC who would eventually become the tough senior detective made famous by Helen Mirren. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet moves a step closer to tracking down Veronica's killer while investigating a recent murder that bears similarities to the cold case. Rachel finds out about an affair Nick once had with a juror in the middle of a trial - a revelation that could end his career. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Rupert Graves.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel has a lucky escape while walking home when she narrowly avoids being hit by a car. Shaken, she starts pursuing the driver, who has fled on foot, and the next day she suspects the incident was an attempted murder - and that Nick may be involved. As she tries to deal with the revelation, Janet is left to take charge of the latest case - the gang shooting of a teenager whose friend is a key witness. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Preston and DS Shaw investigate the theft of a diamond engagement ring, but find the case complicated by an irate wife hell-bent on justice following the hospitalisation of her husband. Acting on information supplied by the woman, officers bring in a suspect, but learn she is engaged to the son of her accuser, who strongly opposes the marriage. Drama, guest starring Diane Keen (Doctors), Georgina Hale (The Bill) and James Sutton (Emmerdale).(n)

programme.title: Homefront
programme.desc: The flags are out as the boys are back in town, but it's a bittersweet day for the Raveleys as they welcome home just one son. There is no happy homecoming for Joe, however, when he discovers Louise has changed the locks. Eventually, the couple reach an uneasy agreement for the sake of the children - but the thought of losing his family tips him over the edge. Drama, starring Warren Brown, Nicola Stephenson, George Costigan and Clare Higgins.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth and James Bellamy discover former housemaid Sarah has fallen on hard times and decide to reinstate her in the household, but it isn't long before their charitable gesture backfires in unexpected fashion. Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh, Simon Williams and Pauline Collins star.(n)

Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew's terminally ill mother asks him to help end her life, while back in Cardale, the past catches up with scheming locum Dr Nick Goodson, exposing his web of lies and deceit in spectacular fashion. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham, Adrian Lukis and Thomas Lockyer star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A London policeman and his doctor wife encounter hostility and suspicion when they move to a close-knit Yorkshire community, but feuding mods and rockers, a mysterious prowler and a budgie-killer mean the couple soon find themselves in the thick of village life. First-ever episode of the popular Sixties-set drama, starring Nick Berry, Niamh Cusack, Derek Fowlds and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick pursues a moorland flasher and drunken hikers, while Kate suffers abuse at the hands of a bullying husband. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Tragedy casts a dark shadow over the idyllic landscape of Aidensfield when Nick receives an anonymous tip-off about a local shopkeeper's unsavoury antics. Meanwhile, Greengrass finds himself in trouble courtesy of the village gossip-mongers. Sixties-based rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: King Edward VII visits Eaton Place for a lavish dinner party, but the servants' duties are interrupted by the untimely appearance of Sarah, who is unfortunately expecting a new arrival of her own. Gordon Jackson and Jean Marsh star.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: A lovelorn, smooth-talking minstrel turns to Robin and his outlaw band for help in rescuing his beloved from the Sheriff of Nottingham's clutches. Michael Praed stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator tries to rescue an emaciated cat that is trapped in an empty house, while Debbie encounters a pack of feral dogs and a grieving widow's pot-bellied pig.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 30-year-old teacher and former beauty queen Tara Grinstead, who vanished from her Georgia home on October 24, 2005. An abandoned latex glove was found in her backyard and police learned she had enjoyed a complex series of relationships with men.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Report on the trial and conviction of New York Mafia boss Vincent Gigante, nicknamed the Oddfather, who was accused of ordering the deaths of seven gangsters and plotting to kill others as revenge for unsanctioned Mob murders.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: How a man accidentally detonated a bomb when he kicked a package. An online terror campaign against his son ensued, leading police to wonder who wants to hurt them.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: A case in which a mother lived in limbo after the mysterious disappearance of her son before a quick-thinking rookie detective and the internet helped solve the case.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Walsenburg, Colorado, in which a frantic emergency telephone call to help a neighbour ended in a bizarre investigation, complete with a twisted tale of torture and family secrets.(n)

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Part two of two. Recalling the events of 2008 when nine-year-old Shannon Matthews was reported missing from her home in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire. Her mother Karen made numerous emotional television appeals, but experts analysed the evidence to pinpoint tell-tale signs of a cover-up by the parent, who eventually confessed that she had known the child's whereabouts all along.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a drug-dependent landlady killed and buried seven victims for their social security cheques. Plus, a serial murderer is convicted on the basis of DNA evidence, 12 years after committing the crime.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The forensic evidence presented in the OJ Simpson trial - the murder investigation and subsequent televised trial that took America by storm.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: The disappearance of a baby girl from her home in 2011 and the story of how her parents were accused of faking her kidnapping.(n)

programme.title: Murder Chose Me
programme.desc: Detective Rod Demery discusses his family past. His mother was murdered, his brother is a murderer - and he has solved over 250 homicides.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: Killings where the bodies were located in swampland, principally due to the perpetrators believing such terrain helps conceal vital evidence against them.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too.
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional `hit' had taken place.(n)

programme.desc: The death of Texas student Kerry Kujawa, who left his campus to visit online girlfriend Kelley McCauley in San Antonio. His dumped body was found two weeks later, in April 2000, on a prairie 130 miles away and it later transpired Kelley was a fictional character invented by Kerry's 32-year-old assailant.(n)

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The case of party-hard mother Casey Anthony, who was found innocent of her daughter's murder. The outcome outraged many because of Anthony's bizarre lies, so the author re-examines what elements of the case the jury see might have missed.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: The murder of Arthur Burney, found shot to death in his barn in February 2011. His wife, Patricia, was convicted of orchestrating a murder-for-hire scheme involving her 14-year-old daughter's boyfriend Michael Richardson.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Jeffrey Marsalis, who had both charm and good looks but was a sexual predator and would take women on dates and drug them. Two of his victims, JoAnn Buttaro and Jessika Rovell, recall their experiences.(n)

programme.desc: The presenter recalls the deadliest mass shooting in US history when 49 people were killed in Orlando's Pulse Nightclub in June 2016.(n)

programme.desc: The case of prisoner Mario, held for abduction and rape. When he managed to escape, he took hostages, killed a policeman, and led FBI officers on a wild chase.(n)

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A man's wife disappears following a late-night food shopping trip - and her body later turns up 15 miles away from their family home.(n)

programme.desc: The investigation into 26-year-old Kim Medlin's mysterious disappearance. Secrets were revealed that shattered the safety of everyone in the town of Monroe, North Carolina.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Kristine Fitzhugh, who apparently fell down a flight of stairs to her death at their home in California. When detectives arrived at the scene in May 2000, the coroner noticed suspicious wounds casting doubt on the cause and placing suspicion on her husband Ken.(n)

programme.title: The Detectives Club: New Orleans
programme.desc: The case of a hairdresser, initially suspected of fatally overdosing on heroin. However, a detective followed a hunch and launched a operation to find her killer.(n)

programme.desc: Detective Barret Morton recalls a case in which a devoted wife and mother was shot and killed in her home. As he dug deeper, he uncovered an illicit affair.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Johnnie Irwin provide expert advice to French teacher Carol, who has been dreaming of returning to France for some time, and her husband Stephen, who believes they should play it safe and move to Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A young rabbit called Speedy has a broken leg after a fight with his female companion Rosie, and the bone is the smallest Noel Fitzpatrick has ever operated on. Ten-month-old Snoopy has been run over by a delivery van and the dog's paw cannot be saved, but the vet thinks he may be able to fix Snoopy up with a prosthetic. And a nine-month-old English bulldog called Winston is brought in as an emergency case with a mysterious paralysis.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another quartet of B&B owners battle it out to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money, beginning with Paul Billington and Flora Loizou from Silverwood Lodge in Cambridgeshire. The couple get a frosty response when one guest learns her hosts do not live on-site, while another is left in hysterics by an unexpected discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group sets off for Great Yarmouth to stay in Sue Dodd's dog-friendly Seashells Guesthouse. Spirits run high with a trip to the beach and a game of bingo, but Nancy's complaints over dog hairs on the sheets and smoking in the rooms bring down the light-hearted mood during dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: American ex-banker Nancy Hampson hosts at the Old Court Guesthouse in Bath, but her vocal criticisms of the week's first two establishments have made her no friends among her fellow competitors. Paul Billington is annoyed that the bed he and wife Flora Loizou are given is not big enough, but is more impressed when taken for food at a quirky local restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay with Caroline Scott, the owner of the Dean B&B near Longniddry, East Lothian The picturesque house and breathtaking views across the Firth of Forth win everyone over, but underwear in the drawers, cobwebs on the curtains and a messy breakfast service seriously hamper the host's chances of success.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Sue from Seashells in Great Yarmouth confronts Nancy Hampson about the controversial topic of smoking in bedrooms, while Paul Billington and Flora Loizou are held to account about their low mark for the Old Court Guesthouse.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet Hampshire couple Eric and Maria, who are looking to find a retirement home but have different ideas about where to relocate. They are split between settling in Romsey, where they will be closer to friends and family, or finding a home in Collioure, France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are torn between returning to family roots in Northumberland or heading to the warmer climate of southern France. Phil and Liz need to find a place big enough to cater for their large family and are searching for somewhere with plenty of land.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: In a dig hampered by rising tides and the discovery of mysterious burials, Tony Robinson and the team search for some of the earliest evidence of Christianity in Britain when they excavate two chapels on Looe Island in Cornwall. With minutes to go before being forced to leave, they make a major discovery.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Friars Wash, Flamstead: The Trouble with Temples.
programme.desc: During the first 15 years of the programme, Tony Robinson and his team never found a Roman temple. However, armed with 30-year-old aerial photographs, they try once more in a field in Hertfordshire, and after an exhausting three-day dig, uncover a complex of four temples, as well as numerous bronze and silver coins and lead curse-tablets made by third-century worshippers.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescued bulldog Dolly is having trouble with all four legs, police dog Anya's spine has been badly damaged, and a retired greyhound called Lola has a mystery problem. `Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick does what he can to help them at the pioneering veterinary practice.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Cornwall in a bid to restore a run-down Triumph Herald that has been housed in a garage for five years.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits an arch-shaped home made of clay tiles in the Weald of Kent, built by Richard Hawkes, who designed the property, and his wife Sophie. It was intended to be energy self-sufficient and able to supply surplus power to the National Grid, but serious problems occurred when the arch collapsed during construction, so the presenter returns to see if their innovative home has lived up to its promise.(n)

programme.title: Secret History
programme.sub-title: The Crossrail Discovery: London's Lost Graveyard.
programme.desc: Documentary catching up with London's Crossrail engineers less than two years after the project's excavations uncovered the 14th-century Charterhouse plague pit. In an extraordinary turn of events, further work on the Liverpool Street station has revealed another burial ground, this time accommodating the capital's radicals, rebels and outsiders. The Bedlam burial ground, which is thought to be the final resting place of nearly 20,000 people, was believed to be lost for around 300 years. Now, with the excavation process under way, archaeologists and historians have been using bone analysis techniques in conjunction with parish records to reveal the names and life stories of those whose remains were found on-site. Their research reveals that people came from as far afield as Africa to work in the English capital, and sheds light on how pollution first became one of the city's most prolific killers.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 21-year-old woman on her first trip to London from Northern Ireland appears to be experiencing kidney failure, and medics fear she could be at risk of a cardiac arrest. A man in a critical condition after falling 20ft from a balcony is brought in by helicopter, and a 34-year-old who fell off her platform shoes while dancing is treated for a deep gash on her forehead.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-three-year-old Ernest is brought in with life-threatening injuries after being knocked down by a hit-and-run driver just outside the hospital. He goes into cardiac arrest, and a consultant must keep his heart going manually in a bid to save his life. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old's finger is mangled by a machine at his metal-working business, and a 51-year-old man with learning difficulties is treated after collapsing, prompting his elderly mother to wonder how he will eventually cope after her death.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 21-year-old woman on her first trip to London from Northern Ireland appears to be experiencing kidney failure, and medics fear she could be at risk of a cardiac arrest. A man in a critical condition after falling 20ft from a balcony is brought in by helicopter, and a 34-year-old who fell off her platform shoes while dancing is treated for a deep gash on her forehead.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-three-year-old Ernest is brought in with life-threatening injuries after being knocked down by a hit-and-run driver just outside the hospital. He goes into cardiac arrest, and a consultant must keep his heart going manually in a bid to save his life. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old's finger is mangled by a machine at his metal-working business, and a 51-year-old man with learning difficulties is treated after collapsing, prompting his elderly mother to wonder how he will eventually cope after her death.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr oversees the disputes and deliberations as Sarah Millican and Nick Grimshaw join Jon Richardson, while Ollie Locke and Joe Wilkinson team up with Sean Lock to answer questions about events that fascinate the great British public.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Trecarne House in Liskeard, Cornwall, where owners Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The pair win the group's admiration by sharing their life story, but one guest stirs up intrigue by holding his cards close to his chest.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners spend their second night of the competition at the Magna Carta at Windsor in Berkshire, a five-star floating bed and breakfast run by Captain Dominic Read. The guests are pleasantly surprised upon arrival, but not all are impressed by the standard of the accommodation - and a cracked teapot at the breakfast table leads to trouble for the proprietor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is Ash Cottage near Leeds Castle in Kent, where the unusual decor is an eye-opener for the guests but is not everyone's cup of tea. Trish and Tom get heated over the instant coffee before owners Rayne and Chris Deal take their fellow contestants to Chatham Dockyard to try their hands at rope-making.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is A Room with a View in Brighton, where owner Stephen Bull and housekeeper Joanna Harris hope their nine-room establishment will impress the contestants. Things get off to a good start when Rayne and Chris Deal are impressed by the cleanliness of the property, but things take a turn for the worse when breakfast gets the thumbs down.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their critics face-to-face. Hosts of Trecarne House in Cornwall Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan raise issues with Magna Carta's Dominic Read on his mark for their hosting, while he has a bone to pick with them over criticism of his five-star floating B&B. Stephen and Joanna of A Room with a View in Brighton receive complaints about their breakfast, and tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Colne Estuary v Canal du Midi.
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps a couple with a love of barges and canals downsize to a property near a waterway so they can pursue their ideal lifestyle and hobbies. Lisa would like to relocate to the Colne Estuary in Essex, but her partner Michael is drawn to the Canal du Midi in southern France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of Paul and Ann Cruxton as they decide whether to relocate to Folkestone, Kent, or the south of France with their £300,000 budget as they plan for their retirement.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The culinary competition comes from in and around Preston, where the first to host is 29-year-old men's barber Lottie, affectionately known as Foghorn.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Preston is support worker Martin Ainsworth, who hopes his menu of classics with a twist will go down a treat with his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fragrance seller Justina is hoping to wow her guests in Preston with a vegan menu and performs reiki on her food to make sure she is in with a chance of winning the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the competition in and around Preston arrives, and confident company director Anthony Smith finally gets his chance to shine. He hopes a winning mix of finger-licking food and fine dining will be enough to secure him the £1,000 prize, but first he much knock Lottie off the top spot.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Built nearly a century before the British canal system, the Canal du Midi in the south of France has been designated a world heritage site. Timothy West and Prunella Scales explore a picturesque stretch, as is it meanders toward the Mediterranean. They visit the town of Beziers and the Malpas Tunnel - Europe's first navigable canal tunnel - and taste the delights of lamb's brain fritters, as well as brandy that is almost 200 years old.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales go in search of the lost route between London and the sea, which has not been fully open for more than 200 years and requires four different boats to traverse now. They leave the Thames at Teddington and travel through the Surrey and Sussex countryside before arriving at Guildford, and a canal-side theatre where they have both regularly performed. The final leg of the trip brings them to the River Arun before reaching the English Channel.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales travel down the Stratford-upon-Avon Canal, accompanied by Tim's daughter and her family. The couple revisit places that hold fond memories from the early stages of their relationship, as well as looking back on the beginnings of their acting careers and putting on a performance in the church where Shakespeare is buried.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter explores the Severn, Britain's longest river, which flows through both England and Wales. Along the way, he visits the largest ship graveyard in the country, meets the last practitioners of an unusual form of fishing, and takes part in a coracle regatta. He finally reaches the source of the river, where he meets a local poet.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from the 1970s, focusing on the comedies, documentaries and public information films that made people so anxious 40 years ago. Some of the famous shows covered include Man Alive and Brass Tacks, as well as The Goodies taking on the police and June Whitfield burning her bra. The show features first-hand accounts from the people who were making telly at the time, including Barry Cryer, Janet Street-Porter and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, revisiting the time of revolution on the small screen in the 1980s. This edition focuses on the concept of fear, dealing with the threats of heroin, glue-sniffing and Aids, Keith Chegwin assessing the impact of video nasties and a young Jeremy Paxman discussing how to survive a nuclear war. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Nigel Farage, Jennie Bond and Chris Tarrant.(n)

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: This unique documentary from Emmy Award-winning producer-turned-director Martin Khodabakhshian sets out to test the limits of mankind's mental and physical endurance. Taking center stage is a Kiwi man, William Trubridge, an expert in the dangerous sport of "freediving," or deep water diving without any mechanical assistance. Trubridge, Khodabakhshian reminds us, holds the world record in this sport, and in this film he attempts to break that record by diving unassisted to a stunning depth of 300 feed - at Dean's Blue Hole in the Bahamas. The film features interviews with Trubridge's family members, friends, and many others(n)

programme.title: Human Family Tree
programme.desc: This National Geographic special begins with a small group of strangers in Queens, NY, and traces their roots back to the same set of ancestors in East Africa. Though they are different races, and their families arrived in the U.S. under completely different circumstances, each person's DNA can nonetheless be traced back to the "cradle of humanity." The Human Family Tree explores the myriad ways that the earliest humans spread across the globe, and analyzes the ties that bind us all(n)

Later, the man behind the stall is found dead on the beach, and when Jane meets with Una, she finds her rude and abrupt. However, in the small hours, Davey and Jane are called to the scene of a second death - the mayor has been found beaten in a hotel room. The pair search for a link between the two deaths, and Jane's quest for the truth puts her life in danger. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Kris Marshall is back as the British detective working on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. And so it appears with the first case when a plantation owner ends up dead during a seance - although with the door firmly closed at the time and all the participants holding hands round the table, who did the deed? The victim's family are convinced it was the work of a ghost said to haunt the plantation, but Humphrey is determined to find a more rational explanation. Meanwhile, Fidel has moved on, leaving Officer Dwayne Myers holding the fort - and while he is struggling to cope, the last thing he needs is the Commissioner stepping in to help. Crime drama, with guest appearances from Holby City's Don Gilet and former Corrie bad girl Natalie Gumede.(n)

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Alive
programme.desc: An investigation into sinkholes, a natural phenomenon that sees the ground give away as a result of weak acid attacking the rocks below, riddling them with holes like Swiss cheese. They can occur gradually, when the surface subsides into bowl-shaped depressions, or suddenly, when the ground gives away - swallowing animals, buildings and even entire highways. This documentary features video footage of dramatic collapses and follows scientists as they explore the underlying forces behind these natural disasters.(n)

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: Jamie contacts a fellow journalist in an attempt to expose the truth about Reiden's involvement in the global animal problem. Sci-fi thriller based on James Patterson and Michael Ledwidge's novel, starring James Wolk.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: CJ has her work cut out trying to play down the resulting scandal when President Bartlet disparages a potential Republican nominee following a TV interview, not realising the cameras are still rolling. Meanwhile, Toby tries to dissuade America's new poet laureate from speaking out about the government's lack of support for a landmine treaty. Laura Dern guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House staff prepare for an environmental crisis after a truck carrying uranium rods crashes in a remote Idaho tunnel, and are forced to face the possibility that terrorists may be responsible. Meanwhile, Vice President John Hoynes, unaware that President Bartlet's electoral strategy may exclude him from the next campaign, ponders how to promote one of his favourite bills, and Donna seeks a presidential proclamation honouring the retirement of her favourite teacher - but doesn't count on Josh's interference. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen, Rob Lowe and Tim Matheson.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Ben Fogle presents the documentary exploring the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out how destructive high-speed winds can be through a series of spectacular reconstructions.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic examines a nine-year-old girl with terminal cancer and decides the illness is not responsible for her hallucinations. programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic tends a construction worker brought in after a fall, and notices the man's fingers are turning purple - a symptom the accident could not have caused. As the team tries different medications, the patient's condition deteriorates and his hand begins to rot - leaving no choice but to amputate. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The maverick medic treats a stubborn and egotistical doctor who has fallen ill while dispensing tuberculosis medicine in Africa. Although the stricken man has all the symptoms of TB, House is convinced something else is responsible for his sickness - but, to highlight the cause he has been promoting, the patient refuses medication. Ron Livingston guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Wild Oats
programme.desc: Premiere. When a woman wrongly receives millions of dollars in life insurance, her best friend convinces her to take off and spend it. Comedy, starring Shirley MacLaine, Jessica Lange and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Four friends stuck in a rut decide to celebrate one of their birthdays in style, but it isn't long before things spiral out of control. Comedy, starring Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart and Hannah Hart.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: Teenager Marty McFly travels back to the 1950s in a time machine built by his eccentric inventor friend. The return journey proves tricky enough, but he also accidentally alters the sequence of events that led to his parents falling in love - and has to persuade his future dad to win his mother's heart, or he will never be born. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson and Crispin Glover.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly travels to the 21st century, where he has to save his children from a terrible fate. However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly is transported back to the days of the Wild West, where he strives to save his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown from death at the hands of a villainous gunslinger. Final instalment in the sci-fi comedy trilogy, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen and Thomas F Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
programme.desc: Premiere. Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Extended version of the action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch

Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
